question: Who among the following is the first Indian Prime Minister to visit Siachen?
explanation: In June 2005, Dr Manmohan Singh created history by becoming the Prime Minister to visit the inhospitable Siachen Glacier, the world's highest battlefield. The 73-year-old Premier, who has undergone a cardiac by-pass surgery, undertook the trip to the Glacier situated at more than 12,000 ft above sea level for first-hand account of the conditions in which the troops are deployed.
